item.title: Banshee stealer evades detection using Apple XProtect encryption algo
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A new version of the Banshee info-stealing malware for macOS has been evading detection over the past two months by adopting string encryption from Apple's XProtect. [...]

item.title: Microsoft fixes OneDrive bug causing macOS app freezes
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​Microsoft has fixed a known issue causing macOS applications to freeze when opening or saving files in OneDrive. [...]

item.title: Proton Mail still down as Proton recovers from worldwide outage
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Privacy firm Proton suffered a massive worldwide outage today, taking down most services, with Proton Mail and Calendar users still unable to connect to their accounts. [...]

item.title: MirrorFace hackers targeting Japanese govt, politicians since 2019
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The National Police Agency (NPA) and the Cabinet Cyber Security Center in Japan have linked a cyber-espionage campaign targeting the country to the Chinese state-backed "MirrorFace" hacking group. [...]

item.title: US Treasury hack linked to Silk Typhoon Chinese state hackers
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​Chinese state-backed hackers, tracked as Silk Typhoon, have been linked to the U.S. Office of Foreign Assets Control (OFAC) hack in early December. [...]

item.title: Google: Chinese hackers likely behind Ivanti VPN zero-day attacks
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Hackers exploiting the critical Ivanti Connect Secure zero-day vulnerability disclosed yesterday installed on compromised VPN appliances new malware called 'Dryhook' and 'Phasejam' that is not currently associated with any threat group. [...]

item.title: Criminal IP: Bringing Real-Time Phishing Detection to Microsoft Outlook
item.dc:creator: Sponsored by Criminal IP
item.description: AI SPERA announced today that it launched its Criminal IP Malicious Link Detector add-in on the Microsoft Marketplace. Learn more about how this tool provides real-time phishing email detection and URL blocking for Microsoft Outlook. [...]

item.title: Microsoft fixes bug causing Outlook to freeze when copying text
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft has fixed a known issue causing the classic Outlook email client to stop responding when copying text with the CTRL+C keyboard shortcut. [...]

item.title: Unpatched critical flaws impact Fancy Product Designer WordPress plugin
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Premium WordPress plugin Fancy Product Designer from Radykal is vulnerable to two critical severity flaws that remain unfixed in the current latest version. [...]

item.title: Ivanti warns of new Connect Secure flaw used in zero-day attacks
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Ivanti is warning that a new Connect Secure remote code execution vulnerability tracked as CVE-2025-0282 was exploited in zero-day attacks to install malware on appliances. [...]

item.title: Russian ISP confirms Ukrainian hackers "destroyed" its network
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Russian internet service provider Nodex confirmed on Tuesday that its network was "destroyed" in a cyberattack claimed by Ukrainian hacktivists part of the Ukrainian Cyber Alliance [...]

item.title: SonicWall urges admins to patch exploitable SSLVPN bug immediately
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: SonicWall is emailing customers urging them to upgrade their firewall's SonicOS firmware to patch an authentication bypass vulnerability in SSL VPN and SSH management that is "susceptible to actual exploitation." [...]

item.title: Hackers exploit KerioControl firewall flaw to steal admin CSRF tokens
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Hackers are trying to exploit CVE-2024-52875, a critical CRLF injection vulnerability that leads to 1-click remote code execution (RCE) attacks in GFI KerioControl firewall product. [...]

item.title: Over 4,000 backdoors hijacked by registering expired domains
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Over 4,000 abandoned but still active web backdoors were hijacked and their communication infrastructure sinkholed after researchers registered expired domains used for commanding them. [...]
